BLL

Class MediaItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • BLL.MediaItem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MediaAsset, MediaElement

    public abstract class MediaItem
extends java.util.Observable
    Media Tree interface - part of composite pattern

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediaItem

        public MediaItem(java.lang.String name,
         java.lang.String description,
         ComponentType mediaType,
         MediaItem parent,
         MediaItemWorkFlow workFlow)
        creates & initialises object
        Parameters:
        name - Sort name displayed as the name of the node
        description - Description of the content item
        mediaType - The component yielded by the item
        parent - The mediaItem that this child belongs to
        workFlow - A object that implements MediaItemWorkFlow interface to provide control of work flow (Strategy Pattern)

      • setMediaSource

        public abstract boolean setMediaSource(MediaSource mediaSource)
        Set the media source for the MediaItem e.g. client, contractor, in house see MediaSource for Enumerations
        Parameters:
        mediaSource - enumerated value to be set
        Returns:
        boolean confirmation of whether the value has been applied

      • getMediaType

        public ComponentType getMediaType()
        Get the media file type of the MediaItem e.g. Video, Audio, etc. see ComponentType for valid enumeration values
        Returns:
        ComponentType enumeration value

        Gets the status of the mediaItem values are as the MediaStatus enumeration
        Returns:
        the status

      • getValidStatusOptions

        public MediaStatus[] getValidStatusOptions(Worker worker)
        Return a valid list of MediaStatus options based upon the Media Items current state and status that the status could be changed to
        Returns:
        MediaStatus[] of valid status option that the current status can be updated to

      • getValidAllocateWorkRoles

        public WorkerRoles[] getValidAllocateWorkRoles(MediaStatus status)
        Provides a list of valid work roles for the given status
        Parameters:
        status - the status to which work roles are required (status values are set by MediaStatus enumeration)
        Returns:
        Array of worker roles (Enumeration WorkerRoles)

      • getFileRequiredWithStatus

        public boolean getFileRequiredWithStatus(MediaStatus status)
        Confirms if a status requires a file before it can be changed
        Parameters:
        status - the status to be checked status values are set by MediaStatus enumeration)
        Returns:
        boolean answer

      • addTask

        protected TaskItem addTask(WorkerRoles workerRole,
               int priority,
               TaskStatus taskStatus,
               java.lang.String description,
               boolean fileRequired,
               Worker allocatedTo)
        Internal method for the creation of TaskItems (tasks) in connection with the this MediaItem All tasks created by this method are automatically added to the TaskList for the project that this MediaItem belongs to
        Parameters:
        workerRole - The work role (WorkerRole enumeration) that the task is to be allocated to
        priority - The priority of the task
        taskStatus - The Status of the task - normally start as TaskStatus.AWAITING_ACTION
        description - A textual description of the task
        fileRequired - Boolean to indicate if a file is required
        Returns:
        The created task

      • setStatus

        public abstract boolean setStatus(MediaStatus status,
                Worker updatingUser,
                java.lang.String Description,
                WorkerRoles roleType,
                Worker allocatedTo,
                int priority)
        Update the media items status and provide the details for the user to create the next task if required
        Parameters:
        status - The new status requested - use getHandledValidStatusOptions to check which options are currently avaliable (based upon it current state)
        updatingUser - The user requesting the status change
        Description - Description used for the creation of any new task in connection with the new status
        roleType - The role of the individual that any new task should be allocated to - use getHandledValidAllocateToWorkerRoles for avaliable options
        allocatedTo - An individual that any task created by the status change will be allocated to (null if only allocated to a worker role)
        Returns:
        confirmation if the update was successful

      • currentTaskCompleted

        public abstract void currentTaskCompleted(java.lang.String Comments)
        Notifies the mediaItem thats it current task has been completed. Used to get mediaItem to complete the next task if appropriate

      • getFile

        public abstract File getFile()
        Returns the current file name
        Returns:
        filename including path

      • canBeDeleted

        public abstract boolean canBeDeleted()
        Check if the node or any of its child nodes have tasks allocated to them If they are tasks allocated the node cannot be removed.
        Returns:
        boolean answer

      • childStatusChanged

        protected void childStatusChanged()
        Allows notification from children nodes that they status has been updated

      • getParent

        public MediaItem getParent()
        Provide reference to the parent object. It will be null if this is the root object
        Returns:
        Parent MediaItem

      • setParent

        Moves this object to a new parent by setting its parent
        Parameters:
        newParent - target node for this mediaItem to be moved to
